Description: A high-level attribute for grouping attributes into templates.
Name of a file. Must be included in DependsOn for all file manifest/annotation templates.
Standard file format name or file extension
Valid Values: csv, tsv, txt, xlsx, xls, fcs, docx, erate, rec, info, vcf, dose, tbi, fam, bim, bed, bam, h5, mtx, bai, rds, pdf, tgz, zip, fastq, parquet, geojson, tar.gz, h5ad

Description: Name of the funding program that supported the generation of data and associated files
Valid Values: AMP RA/SLE, AMP AIM, Community Contribution

Description: A sub-level attribute of `program` specifying a research initiative working to investigate particular hypotheses.
Valid Values: RA, SLE, AIM for RA, STAMP, LOCKIT, V-CoRT, ELLIPSS

Description: High-level classification of the file content
Valid Values: experimental data, metadata, figure, code

Description: The source of the nucleic acid used as input for sequencing library fragments. Select all that apply, though in most cases only a single label is expected.
Valid Values: poly(A) RNA, rRNA-depleted RNA, gDNA, surface protein feature barcode, intracellular protein feature barcode, antigen capture barcode, multiplexing oligo, BCR mRNA, TCR mRNA, Tn5-accessible gDNA, globin-depleted RNA, CRISPR protospacer feature barcode

Description: Sequencing library preparation method or kit used to create the library. If no commercially available kit was used, please select 'in-house library prep'.
Valid Values: NEBNext Ultra II Directional RNA Library, QIAseq miRNA Library, SMART-Seq v4 Ultra Low Input RNA, Nextera XT, SMARTer Stranded Total RNA v2, Nextera XT DNA, TruSeq Stranded mRNA, SMART-Seq Human BCR with UMI, SMART-Seq Human TCR with UMI, Takara Human BCR profiling for Illumina, Takara Human TCR profiling for Illumina, Takara Human TCRv2 profiling for Illumina, Takara Human scTCR profiling for Illumina, NEBNext Human Immune Sequencing Kit, CEL-Seq2, in-house library prep, Fluidigm C1 HT, 10x Chromium Next GEM Single Cell 3', 10x Chromium Next GEM Single Cell 3' 3.1, 10x Chromium Next GEM Single Cell 5' v2, 10x Chromium GEM-X Single Cell 5' v3, 10x Chromium GEM-X Single Cell 3' v4, 10x GEM-X Universal 5â€™ Gene Expression v3, 10x GEM-X Flex Gene Expression Human, 10x Chromium Fixed RNA Human Transcriptome, 10x Chromium Single Cell Human TCR, 10x Chromium Single Cell Human BCR, 10x Chromium Next GEM Single Cell ATAC v2, 10x Chromium Next GEM Single Cell 5' v1.1, Chromium Next GEM Single Cell ATAC v1.1, custom DASH-treatment

Description: A library label or name, unique within an experiment, used to distinguish sequencing libraries.
Total number of reads sequenced from the library.

The specific version (manufacturer, model, etc.) of a technology that is used to carry out a laboratory or computational experiment. Specify where applicable for experimental data files, else enter 'none'. In most cases only a single label is expected, however multiple selections can be provided in comma-delimited list where applicable e.g., for 10x Genomics fastq files please specify both the 10x instrument and the sequencing platform.
Valid Values: CyTOF XT, Helios Mass Cytometer, Hyperion, Illumina NextSeq 500, Illumina HiSeq 2500, Illumina NovaSeq 6000, Illumina NovaSeq X, Chromium X, Chromium iX, Chromium Xo, Chromium Controller, Visium CytAssist, Xenium, BD FACSAria Fusion cell sorter, none, Illumina HiSeq X Ten, Chromium Next GEM Chip G, GEM-X OCM 5' Chip, Chromium Next GEM Chip M, Chromium Next GEM Chip Q, Chromium Next GEM Chip H, Chromium GEM-X Single Cell 3' Chip v4, Chromium Next GEM Chip K, GEM-X Flex Gene Expression Chip

Description: A label indicating batching of sample processing or preparation that occurs prior to data collection.
A label indicating batching that occurs during data collection, e.g., collecting data across multiple days.

Name of probe set used in 10x Chromium Flex, Xenium, and Visium data. If custom modified probe set was used the probe reference should be included as metadata accompanying the experimental data files.
Valid Values: Flex Human Transcriptome Probe Set v1.1.0, Flex Human Transcriptome Probe Set v1.0.1, Visium Human Transcriptome v2, Visium Human Transcriptome v1, custom probe set

Description: A description of the marker gating strategy used to derive the population cells with FACS.
Functional Model of Anatomy ontology ID corresponding to the anatomical site and origin of the biospecimen. This is a conditionally dependent attribute triggered by a subset of `biospecimenType`.
Functional Model of Anatomy ontology label corresponding to the FMAID of the biospecimen collection site.
Valid Values: left 2nd MCP joint, left ankle joint, left hip joint, left knee joint, left wrist joint, other site, right 1st MTP joint, right 2nd MCP joint, right 2nd MTP joint, right 3rd MCP joint, right ankle joint, right hip joint, right knee joint, right wrist joint, unknown

Description: The technology used to generate the data in this file. For multimodal datasets with concomitant profiling of biospecimen select all assays that apply. e.g., the GEX files from a CITE-seq experiment should be labeled with both 'scRNASeq' and 'CITESeq'.
Valid Values: scRNASeq, CyTOF, Xenium, Olink Explore HT, CITESeq, snRNASeq, snATACSeq, RNASeq, multiplexed ELISA, SNP array, imaging mass cytometry, H&E, ASAPSeq, CosMX, serial IHC, imaging mass spectrometry, LC-MS/MS, CE-MS, VDJSeq, scVDJSeq, feature barcode sequencing, SomaScan, WES, WGS, flow cytometry, NULISA

Description: A unique identifier assigned to specimens collected from study participants. For multi-specimen data files provide all IDs in a comma-separated list.
Validation Rules: #RASLEBiospecimenMetadataTemplate unique error^^#BiospecimenMetadataTemplate unique error^^list like error

Description: Biospecimen status before sample is processed into a scRNA-seq library. Several scRNA-seq technologies support a variety of sample processing methods which can introduces sources of technical variation.
Valid Values: nuclei suspension, cell suspension, fresh tissue, frozen tissue, FFPE tissue, flow-sorted cells, PFA-fixed tissue

Description: A label indicating the biological material collected for experimentation and data collection. Where applicable, provide all types in a comma-separated list.
Valid Values: none, urine, stool, whole blood, serum, plasma, PBMCs, total leukocytes, kidney biopsy, synovial fluid, skin biopsy, salivary gland, saliva, skin swab, synovial tissue, suction blister cells, suction blister fluid, uvea, fibroblast-like synoviocyte

Description: Cell Ontology CL identifier that best describes a biopsecimen used to generate data, e.g., CL:0000084 for T cell.
The cell type name from Cell Ontology for the corresponding CL identifier.
The coding, aka programming, language(s) contained in the file marked with `resourceType = code`. Select all that apply.
Valid Values: R, Python, Java, C, C++, C#, Ruby, Julia, Fortan, SAS, Matlab

Description: If custom modified probe sets were used for collecting 10x Chromium Flex scRNA-seq data, then the probe reference files should be grouped as a zip or tar archive and uploaded as metadata. This attribute links the experimental data back to the probe set archive file via a synapse ID.
Level of data processing applied to file. Levels refer to pre-defined standards of processing for the given assay.

General classification to differentiate between omics profiling modalities. If N/A please select 'none'. Multiple selections can be provided in a comma-delimited list, however this is largely only expected in the context of Datasets and files that contain integrated experimental data spanning multiple types.
Valid Values: bulk, pseudobulk, single-cell, single-nucleus, spatial, none

Description: High-level classification of the type of data contained in the file, loosely related to the experimental method or biological entity that is being profiled. Select all that apply using a comma-delimited list, though in most cases only a single label is expected. For multimodal datasets with concomitant profiling of biospecimen include 'multimodal'.
Valid Values: transcriptomics, immune repertoire profiling, proteomics, multimodal, epigenomics, genomics, metabolomics, lipidomics, microbiome, histology, immunostaining, cytometry

Description: A high-level classifier indicating the disease status of an individual.
Valid Values: control, SLE, RA, At-Risk RA, vitiligo, dermatomyositis, PsO, PsA, scleroderma, SjD, LN, CLE, OA

Description: Unique identifier assigned to each study participant. For multi-specimen data files provide all IDs in a comma-separated list.
Validation Rules: #ClinicalMetadataTemplate unique error^^#BiospecimenMetadataTemplate str^^#RASLEBiospecimenMetadataTemplate str^^list like error

Description: A standardized, semi-quantitative measure of the degree of inflammatory infiltrate in synovial specimen. This is one of three measures used to derive the Krenn Synovitis Score (KSS) which is a histological scoring system used to quantify inflammation in synovial tissue biopsies, particularly in the context of inflammatory arthritis like rheumatoid arthritis.

A standardized, semi-quantitative measure of the degree of hyperplasia/enlargement of the synovial lining layer of synovial specimen. This is one of three measures used to derive the Krenn Synovitis Score (KSS) which is a histological scoring system used to quantify inflammation in synovial tissue biopsies, particularly in the context of inflammatory arthritis like rheumatoid arthritis.

A standardized, semi-quantitative measure of stromal cell density of synovial specimen. This is one of three measures used to derive the Krenn Synovitis Score (KSS) which is a histological scoring system used to quantify inflammation in synovial tissue biopsies, particularly in the context of inflammatory arthritis like rheumatoid arthritis.

The Krenn Synovitis Score (KSS) is a histological scoring system used to quantify inflammation in synovial tissue biopsies, particularly in the context of inflammatory arthritis like rheumatoid arthritis.
Metadata standards used to generate the metadata
Valid Values: user-defined, ARK data model

Description: A label further classifying the content of metadata resource.
Valid Values: biospecimen, protocol, template, user manual, assay, target panel, data dictionary, single-cell metadata

Description: A label noting which AMP RA/SLE program phase generated the data.
Valid Values: I, II

Description: Classification of saliva collection procedure. This is a conditionally dependent attribute triggered for saliva `biospecimenType`.
Valid Values: stimulated, unstimulated

Description: Disease manifestation status of skin biospecimen.
Valid Values: lesional, lesional proximal, non-lesional, healthy control

Description: Relevant software and version used to generate the data file.
Valid Values: Cell Ranger 9.0.1, Cell Ranger v9.0.0, Cell Ranger v8.0.1, Cell Ranger v8.0.0, Cell Ranger v7.2.0, Cell Ranger v7.1.0, Cell Ranger v7.0.1, Cell Ranger v7.0.0, Cell Ranger v6.1.2, Cell Ranger v6.1.1, Cell Ranger v6.1.0, Cell Ranger v6.0.2, Cell Ranger v6.0.1, Cell Ranger v6.0.0, Cell Ranger v5.0.1, Cell Ranger v5.0.0, Cell Ranger v4.0.0, Cell Ranger v3.1.0, Cell Ranger v3.0.2, Cell Ranger v3.0.1, Cell Ranger v3.0.0, Space Ranger 3.1.3, Space Ranger 3.1.2, Space Ranger 3.1.1, Space Ranger 3.1.0, Space Ranger 3.0.1, Space Ranger 3.0.0, demuxlet, BD FACSDiva 8.0.1, Cell Ranger ATAC v1.1.0

Description: Label assigned to experimental data files indicating whether the data contained corresponds to a single or multiple biospecimens
Valid Values: single specimen, multispecimen

Description: Classification of procedure for synovial tissue collection.
Valid Values: biopsy, arthroplasty, synovectomy

Description: User-defined label of a cell type. Contributors are provided this option to use preferred or custom cell type labels that may vary from options and standards set by Cell Ontology.
Ordinal ID distinguishing different patient visits.
A high-level classification of vitiligo based on the distribution and patterning of lesions across the body.
Valid Values: segmental, non-segmental, mixed, unclassified
